ovdesc.p: This application contains the rules regarding which types of transaction take priority where there is more than one outstanding transaction against a settlement account. It ranks by product within an EB.SYSTEM.ID. There are three linked tables

p.p: RC.PRODUCT.PRIORITY - Ranks by product within an EB.SYSTEM.ID

desc.p: The ID to file can be either an EB.SYSTEM.ID or AA.PRODUCT.GROUP
Must be a valid record on either EB.SYSTEM.ID or AA.PRODUCT.GROUP
This field is used to link to the transaction level priorities that have been set up in the application RC.CONTRACT.PRIORITY and will be applied to the AA.PRODUCT.
Forms part of a multi value set with AA.PRODUCT.
Mandatory input is the @id is an AA.PRODUCT.GROUP
No Input field for non AA
Must be a valid record on RC.CONTRACT.PRIORITY
This field is used to define the priority in order of AA product group. For example LOANS, Deposits etc
Form part of a multi value set with the field AA.CONTRACT.PRT
Mandatory input is the @id is an AA.PRODUCT.GROUP
No Input field for non AA
Must be a valid record on AA.PRODUCT
This field is used to link to the transaction level priorities that have been set up in the application RC.CONTRACT.PRIORITY and will be applied.
Forms part of a multi value set with AA.PRODUCT.
Mandatory input is the @id is an EB.SYSTEM.ID
Must be a valid record on RC.CONTRACT.PRIORITY
Local reference field(s) defined by the user. Identifies any additional element which has been defined locally to meet a particular requirement.
Up to 35 Any characters as defined in the local table definition for this local reference field.
(Optional input. Multi-valued field). Optional or mandatory input according to the LOCAL.TABLE definition for this field.
This field indicates the end of the product category range of the underlying product.
Forms part of a multi value set with the fields;
Must be a valid record on CATEGORY
If the field PROD.CAT.START is entered but this field is null then only the start category will be used.

This field is used to indicate the start of the product category range from the underlying contract if there was one, or the account product category. This can be used to prioritise loan and deposit for settlement transactions from non AA contracts. For non contract related updates such as IC and FT the categories will refer to the settlement account category.
Forms part of a multi value set with the fields;
Must be a valid record on CATEGORY
This is a multi valued field.
Contains details of any override applicable to this record.
A maximum of 35 characters may be entered. This is a NOINPUT field.
This field is reserved for future use
